alert.note: Alert for Sierra Madre Range; Snowy Range (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued November 03 at 4:17PM MDT until November 04 at 6:00AM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM MDT FRIDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 12 inches. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...Sierra Madre Range and Snowy Range. * WHEN...From midnight tonight to 6 AM MDT Friday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Hunters and hikers could become disoriented and lost in low visibility. * ADDITIONAL IMPACTS...By late Friday afternoon, west winds are expected to increase with gusts over 60 MPH possible by Friday evening. Greatly reduced visibilities in blowing snow possible late Friday afternoon and Friday night.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
